data.name: Kerupuk Udang
data.description: Shrimp crackers, often served as a crunchy accompaniment to various Indonesian dishes.

data.name: Bubuk Cabai
data.description: Ground chili powder often sprinkled over dishes to add a spicy kick.

data.name: Emping Melinjo
data.description: Crispy crackers made from the melinjo nut, usually served as a crunchy side dish or snack.

data.name: Kacang Goreng
data.description: Fried peanuts, often served as a crunchy snack or added to dishes for extra texture.

data.name: Keripik Singkong
data.description: Cassava chips, fried until crispy and commonly enjoyed as a snack or side dish.

data.name: Petis
data.description: A thick black shrimp paste used as a condiment, adding a rich umami flavor to dishes.

data.name: Serundeng
data.description: Spiced coconut flakes, often added to dishes like nasi uduk or served with fried chicken.

data.name: Bawang Goreng
data.description: Fried onion with crunchy texture, suitable for any hot dishes and rice
